channel.title: Number Login
channel.description:
I'm not sure if this is Server sided or Client sided, (if it's Client sided no wonder I can't figure it out, cause i'm terrible with clients) Basically when lets say I login with the username Entinity, the in-game name will be tinity and it would be registered as tinity in the characters. However if I login with 123Entinity, the username will be Entinity and it will be registered Entinity in characters.txt, I was wondering how I could fix this strange problem and if it was Client sided.
Regards, James.

item.title: Number Login
item.dc:creator: @rigorous rigorous
item.description:
@rigorous wrote:

ehh this is new to me, it is obv client sided because nothing server sided happens until you log in. try searching this,

public final void loginMethod(int i)
{
loginDelaynumeral19 = 3charDelay;
if user; = => 3 delay.3chars ;
return;

that was all i could find on that problem, doesnt look too legit to me but then again i dont know if its 317 or 562 or what. if your using a 614 you wont ever get help, lol. sorry bro, hope i helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Number Login
item.dc:creator: @X_Entinity_X X Entinity X

I’m not sure if this is Server sided or Client sided, (if it’s Client sided no wonder I can’t figure it out, cause i’m terrible with clients)
